target_audience.primary_persona: NYT Pips puzzle enthusiasts who want AI-assisted solving
secondary_personas: Casual mobile puzzle gamers seeking quick solutions
Puzzle learners who prefer hints over direct answers
Power users who want to understand puzzle-solving strategies
pain_points: Stuck on difficult Pips puzzles with no in-game hints
Hard to track constraint logic mentally
Want to learn strategies without spoiling the puzzle completely
No easy way to get partial hints
goals: Quickly solve Pips puzzles from screenshots
Get strategic hints without full spoilers
target_audience.usage_context: Mobile users playing NYT Pips on their phone who take a screenshot when stuck and want AI assistance to solve or get hints for the puzzle

product_vision.one_liner: AI-powered mobile app that solves NYT Pips puzzles from screenshots with optional hints or full solutions
product_vision.problem_statement: NYT Pips puzzles can be challenging with no built-in hint system, leaving players stuck with no way to progress without fully looking up solutions online and spoiling the experience
product_vision.value_proposition: Unlike looking up solutions online, Pips Solver offers graduated assistance - from strategic hints to full solutions - using AI to extract puzzles from screenshots and a constraint-satisfaction solver for accurate answers
success_metrics: Puzzle extraction accuracy rate (currently ~40-60% on complex puzzles)
Time from screenshot to solution under 10 seconds
User engagement with hints vs full solve feature

existing_features: 4-step puzzle builder wizard (Grid alignment, Region painting, Constraints, Dominoes)
CV-based grid geometry extraction from screenshots
Multi-strategy detection system (region contours, color segmentation, constraint labels)
Image preprocessing with CLAHE contrast enhancement
AI agent for puzzle analysis using Claude
AI verification modal for user corrections
known_gaps: OCR improvements needed for better constraint reading
Region detection imperfect on complex layouts
Grid dimension estimation approximate for irregular layouts
technical_debt: Automated tests missing - marked as TODO throughout codebase
Diamond detection works but cell inference from markers incomplete
40% confidence when actual accuracy may be higher
Multiple worktrees suggest active parallel development that may need consolidation

alternatives: General AI assistants (ChatGPT, Claude) with manual description
Other puzzle solver apps (Sudoku solvers, crossword helpers)
differentiators: Screenshot-based automatic puzzle extraction - no manual input needed
Graduated assistance from hints to full solutions
Specialized for NYT Pips game specifically
Mobile-first design for on-device puzzle solving
AI-powered with computer vision for puzzle understanding
CSP solver for mathematically correct solutions
competitive_context.market_position: Niche productivity tool for NYT Pips players - first-to-market specialized solver with screenshot extraction, competing against generic online solutions that require manual input or spoil the entire puzzle

technical: CV extraction accuracy varies with puzzle complexity (40-60% on complex puzzles)
OCR performance depends on image quality and text clarity
Requires API key for Claude AI agent functionality
Mobile device camera/screenshot quality affects detection
Memory usage ~50MB per image during processing
resources: Solo developer or small team (no multi-contributor git history)
Active development with multiple parallel worktrees
Reliance on external AI API (Anthropic Claude)
dependencies: Anthropic API for Claude agent (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY required)
OpenCV and scikit-learn for computer vision
FastAPI backend must be accessible from mobile app
